business.headline: Who files belated ITRs most often? Salaried employees, freelancers or gig workersWho ends up filing belated ITRs most often; salaried employees, freelancers or gig workers? While the Income-tax Department does not release category-wise data, expert observations reveal surprising trends behind delayed filings.

Inside the tax refund limbo: The bigger story behind the 'put on hold' alertsThousands of tax refunds were suddenly put on hold and the message gave no reasons, no timelines. What is really going on inside the income tax system, and why are even honest taxpayers being flagged?

More jobs, higher incomes: New Zealand PM Luxon hails India free trade agreementIndia and New Zealand have successfully concluded a comprehensive Free Trade Agreement, marking a significant milestone in bilateral relations.

Defence personnel get specialised home loan options. Details hereAs competition rises and metro demand cools, housing finance firms are recalibrating strategies, betting on defence families as low-risk, long-term borrowers who need customised loans rather than generic salaried products.

PAN–Aadhaar not linked after December 31? Be ready for penalty and ITR issuesThe December 31 PAN–Aadhaar linking deadline is crucial for taxpayers, as missing it may lead to penalties, ITR filing restrictions, refund delays and higher tax deductions at source.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as year-end rally fizzlesThe BSE Sensex closed at 85,041.45, down 367.25 points or 0.43%, while the NSE Nifty50 settled at 26,042.30, lower by 99.80 points. The session remained volatile, with markets slipping after early stability as investors turned cautious at higher levels.

Is India's housing market entering a new phase of lower sales but higher value?Even though the number of homes sold declined, the overall value of housing sales increased by 6% year-on-year. The total sales value crossed Rs 6 lakh crore in 2025, up from about Rs 5.68 lakh crore in the previous year, mentioned report.

Explained: Why copper prices have hit a record highThe rally is not the result of a single trigger. Instead, it reflects a powerful mix of rising demand, tight supply and supportive global conditions that have reshaped the copper market.

Why are Swiggy, Zomato and Amazon gig workers going on strike on December 31?The strike has been announced by the Telangana Gig and Platform Workers Union along with the Indian Federation of App-Based Transport Workers.

Wonder drug for male baldness puts Swiss firm Cosmo's shares on steroidsStrong trial data has rewritten Cosmo's prospects, but the real test lies ahead as regulators, partners and patients decide whether this promising science can truly deliver commercial success globally eventually.

Sensex tumbles over 400 points: Why is the stock market down today?At 1:02 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 386.20 points to 85,022.50, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 106.80 points to trade at 26,035.30. Most of the broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility rose during the session.

Hindustan Copper shares at 15-year high: What's driving the rallyThe stock has been one of the standout performers in the metal space, and Friday's move reflects a mix of strong commodity trends and sustained investor interest.

Made a mistake in your ITR? Here's how many times you can still revise itIf you think filing your income tax return locks everything in, that is not entirely true. The tax department recognises that genuine mistakes can happen and allows taxpayers to revise their returns, provided they act within the allowed time window.

How will insurance industry trends create new opportunities in 2026?Powered by artificial intelligence, rising climate risks, and changing customer expectations, the insurance industry is now silently transforming itself. Some of the trends that we may see in 2026 could look very different from what most people expect today.

Gold, silver extend record rally: Should you buy now?With gold anchoring portfolios and silver leading returns, should investors keep adding exposure, or step back and wait as record prices test discipline and long-term allocation strategies?

Is India's real estate market entering a more mature and institutional phase?Forces such as digitisation, institutional capital and changing consumer preferences reshaped the sector. More than just building structures, real estate is now about creating ecosystems that are interoperable with transit, logistics, digital infrastructure and services.

What happens if you do not file a revised ITR after your refund is put on holdWhen a return is flagged under the risk management framework, the refund does not move forward on its own. If a taxpayer does not revise the return or respond to the issue flagged, the refund can remain on hold indefinitely, even if the claim is otherwise genuine.

RVNL share price zooms over 11% today. What investors need to knowAt around 10:32 am, the RVNL share price was trading 11.01% higher at Rs 383.75 on the BSE, making it one of the top-performing public sector stocks during the session.

IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

entertainment.headline: Did you know Akshaye Khanna once said nepotism helped him land his first role? Akshaye Khanna has withdrawn from Drishyam 3 after disagreements over remuneration and creative aspects, with producer Kumar Mangat Pathak confirming Jaideep Ahlawat as his replacement and legal action being considered by the production company.

Harry Styles' surprise 8-minute video sparks speculation of fourth solo album Harry Styles has unexpectedly unveiled a new music video for his previously unreleased ballad 'Forever, Forever', sparking discussion amongst fans about his future musical direction and possible tour plans.

Dhurandhar box office day 23: Beats Awara, Dunki and 3 Idiots overseas The espionage thriller Dhurandhar has surpassed major milestones at the Indian box office, entering the top 10 highest earners and setting the stage for a pan-India and global sequel release in 2026.

I broke down: Karan Johar on working with Amitabh Bachchan, Lata Filmmaker Karan Johar has described the intense pressure he faced while directing Amitabh Bachchan and collaborating with Lata Mangeshkar for his second feature film, Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham, at just 28 years old.

Dhurandhar, Chhaava, Saiyaara: Heroes battling chaos redeemed Bollywood's 2025 Bollywood's 2025 was redeemed by three films – Dhurandhar, Chhaava and Saiyaara. In their own ways, the heroes of these films scored by battling chaos while flawless machismo in Sikandar, War 2 and Jaat failed to enthuse viewers.

Prabhas' The Raja Saab director makes bold promise to fans. Check it out here At a pre-release event for the upcoming film The Raja Saab, director Maruthi made a public commitment to fans, assuring them of the film's quality and highlighting lead actor Prabhas's performance ahead of its scheduled January 9 release.

Why Dhurandhar worked: Mega success of 2025's biggest blockbuster decoded Ranveer Singh's latest hit 'Dhurandhar' proved that when storytelling meets scale, the big screen wins. OTT may be convenient, but cinema, when done right, remains irreplaceable.

Suniel Shetty says he rejected a Rs 40 crore tobacco ad on principle Suniel Shetty has revealed that he refused a Rs 40 crore tobacco endorsement, stating that personal values, health, and his responsibility as a father outweigh financial incentives.

Unlike any other: Sobhita Dhulipala reviews Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar Actor Shobhita Dhulipala shared her review of Aditya Dhar directorial Dhurandhar. The sequel of the film is scheduled for release on March 19, 2026.

Athiya Shetty shares unseen photo of Evaarah with KL Rahul on first Christmas Athiya Shetty posted photos on Instagram on December 27, offering a look at her holiday celebrations with cricketer KL Rahul and their daughter Evaarah.

Thalapathy Vijay raises his fist in joy as fans say 2026 is ours. Viral video Actor Vijay responded to a fan's proclamation about 2026 elections with a symbolic gesture during the Jana Nayagan audio launch in Malaysia. The video is now going viral.

How Salman Khan met my mother Kunickaa after 30 years: Ayaan Lall reveals Actor Salman Khan had an unexpected reunion with actor Kunickaa Sadanand, facilitated by her son and fellow actor Ayaan Lall, during the filming of their latest project. The interaction occurred over three decades after their last collaboration, creating a memorable moment on set.

BTS' Kim Taehyung sends Indian fans into a frenzy after almost confirming India tour  BTS' Kim Taehyung, aka V, sparked excitement among Indian fans after greeting them with a "Namaste" and hinting at a possible visit during his latest Weverse live.

Bigg Boss 19's Malti Chahar recalls growing up amid family conflict Bigg Boss 19 finalist Malti Chahar has shared her experiences of growing up amid parental discord, restrictive upbringing, and societal challenges, offering insight into the difficulties faced during her adolescence.

Vijay asks fans to avoid political chants at Jana Nayagan event in Malaysia. Watch Actor Vijay urged his supporters not to chant his political party's name, TVK, during the Jana Nayagan audio launch after Malaysian authorities imposed a strict ban on political speech and symbols at the entertainment-only event.

Fan frenzy greets Vijay at Jana Nayagan audio launch in Kuala Lumpur. Watch video Thousands gather at Bukit Jalil Stadium in Malaysia for the audio launch of Vijay's highly anticipated film Jana Nayagan, amid announcement that this is his final public event as an actor, before focusing on politics.

Jugal Hansraj recalls Shabana Azmi's acting method during Masoom shoot Jugal Hansraj recalled how Shabana Azmi deliberately kept her distance from him during the shooting of Masoom as part of her acting process.

Alia's Alpha postponed to avoid clash with Salman's Battle of Galwan: Trade report Yash Raj Films has postponed the release of the spy thriller Alpha, starring Alia Bhatt and Sharvari, originally set for April 2026, to avoid competing with Salman Khan's Battle of Galwan. The production house is yet to announce a revised release date.

Lokesh Kanagaraj accepts Coolie criticism, says he will improve next film Director Lokesh Kanagaraj responds to criticism of his ensemble film Coolie, starring Rajinikanth, which despite negative reviews has achieved significant box office success.

general news.headline: 2 suspects in Osman Hadi murder fled to India via Meghalaya, say Bangladesh policeTwo prime suspects in the murder of Bangladeshi political activist Osman Hadi have fled to India through the Meghalaya border, police said. The Bangladesh government is actively communicating with Indian authorities for their arrest and extradition.

Over 30 Pak terrorists active in Jammu, warns intel; Army steps up winter opsJammu and Kashmir is witnessing sustained counter-terror operations despite harsh winter conditions. The Indian Army and allied forces are intensifying efforts to neutralise terror threats in snowbound regions this Chillai Kalan.

Organisation must be strengthened: Tharoor backs Digvijaya Singh amid RSS praise rowOn the 140th Congress Foundation Day, Shashi Tharoor backed Digvijaya Singh, stressing the need to strengthen the party organisation amid a row over Singh's remarks praising the BJP–RSS organisational strength.

16-hour wait for bed in emergency: Why Canada's healthcare system is in ICUAn Indian-origin father of three young kids died at an Edmonton hospital despite crying for a bed for eight hours. Canada-based Indians say it could take up to 16 hours to get medical treatment in emergency rooms and months for doctor appointments. What is ailing the healthcare system of Canada, considered a developed country?

How Indian techies became new Communists for AmericansSuch was the fear and hate for Communists in the US, spouses used to spy on their partners. That same paranoia now seems to have been reserved for Indian techies. But how did Indians, who helped build Silicon Valley, become such subject of hate?

I am sorry: An MP's apology to India's tax-paying citizensThe government is busy thumping its chest over "productivity." It claims 111% productivity in the Lok Sabha and 121% in the Rajya Sabha. But what does productivity mean in a democracy? Is it merely the number of hours MPs occupied their seats?

Act with compassion: Congress's advice to Siddaramaiah on Bengaluru demolitionsThe demolition drive near Bengaluru's Kogilu village has sparked internal dissent within the Congress party, with senior leaders urging caution and compassion. The issue has escalated into a political tussle involving protests, opposition criticism, and sharp remarks from leaders across states.

Pride, now paid: How BCCI turned Indian cricket into a high-paying professionFrom Rs 2,100 match fees to Rs 7-crore contracts, we examine how the BCCI's broadcast boom, central contracts and domestic pay hikes transformed Indian cricket from a passion sustained by jobs into a full-time profession.

India helped free Bangladesh. Why is it then a target of public rage?Bangladesh's anti-India sentiment, long an undercurrent shaped by history, geography and political rivalry, has intensified over the past decade as Sheikh Hasina's rule became increasingly identified with New Delhi's backing. Here's how it took shape, from the 1976 protests to the unrest of 2025.

Why Dhurandhar worked: Mega success of 2025's biggest blockbuster decodedRanveer Singh's latest hit 'Dhurandhar' proved that when storytelling meets scale, the big screen wins. OTT may be convenient, but cinema, when done right, remains irreplaceable.

Tripura student dies after racial attack with knife, kada; fought for life for 17 daysA protest against racial abuse at a roadside canteen in Dehradun has tragically ended with the death of a 24-year-old student from Tripura. The police have intensified their investigation and are searching for an absconding accused in the case.

Nasa chief offers student job & jet for finding 1.5 million starsNasa director Jared Isaacman has offered a high school student a job and a fighter jet ride following his identification of 1.5 million cosmic bodies. Matteo Paz utilised artificial intelligence to analyse decommissioned mission data, uncovering celestial phenomena previously missed by researchers.

Dhurandhar, Chhaava, Saiyaara: Heroes battling chaos redeemed Bollywood's 2025Bollywood's 2025 was redeemed by three films – Dhurandhar, Chhaava and Saiyaara. In their own ways, the heroes of these films scored by battling chaos while flawless machismo in Sikandar, War 2 and Jaat failed to enthuse viewers.

The invention women use every month, and the woman behind itMary Kenner invented a sanitary belt with a moisture-proof pocket in the 1920s but faced racial discrimination that blocked her success. Her legacy highlights resilience and the overlooked contributions of Black women inventors.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in 2025: A year India learnt to savour Ro-Ko2025 did not close with grand farewells for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Instead, it unfolded as a year of quiet endings, shifting roles and timely reminders of why Indian cricket still leans on them.

While the Income-tax Department does not release category-wise data, expert observations reveal surprising trends behind delayed filings.

The jobs Gen Z ditched in 2025, and what replaced themIn 2025, Gen Z began moving away from traditional career paths as entry-level roles shrank and AI changed hiring. From rigid corporate jobs to the idea of dream careers, young workers quietly pivoted towards skills, flexibility, gig work and practical roles that offered control and stability.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Aravallis under threat? Decoding what's protected, what's notTo understand what the new definition protects, and what it leaves exposed, we examine Amer Ghati, a historic hill corridor in the Aravallis.

Hear the stars sing: Nasa turns cosmic wonders into haunting musicNasa has unveiled a sonification symphony that turns telescope data into orchestral music. Experience the life cycles of stars through pieces in the galactic centre, the Crab Nebula, and pillars of creation.

Bring Virat Kohli out of Test retirement: Navjot Sidhu reveals his one wish to godNavjot Singh Sidhu has made an emotional appeal for Virat Kohli's Test return. Citing Kohli's elite fitness and form, Sidhu believes a comeback would unite and uplift Indian cricket fans nationwide.

11 years in MBBS first year: BRD medical college faces rare academic caseAn unusual academic case has surfaced at Gorakhpur's BRD Medical College, where an MBBS student has remained enrolled for over a decade without progressing beyond the first year. The incident has raised serious concerns over regulatory oversight and institutional accountability.

Rishabh Pant to be dropped from New Zealand ODI series: SourcesRishabh Pant is set to be dropped from India's ODI squad for the New Zealand series. His absence could open the door for in-form Ishan Kishan to return to the ODI setup, or Jitesh Sharma receiving his maiden call-up.
Sabarimala earnings hit Rs 332 crore as shrine draws over 30 lakh pilgrimsOver 30.56 lakh devotees visited Sabarimala during the Mandala Pooja season, reflecting a steady rise in pilgrim footfall.

sports.headline: MCG curator left shocked after Ashes Test ends in 2 days: Didn't go as per plan Ashes 2025-26: Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) pitch curator Matt Page revealed that he was left shocked following a two-day finish in the fourth Ashes Test. England beat Australia by four wickets as the game ended within 142 overs.

Pakistan kabaddi player banned for playing with India-linked team in private event Pakistani kabaddi star Ubaidullah Rajput has been banned indefinitely by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation after representing an Indian team at a private tournament in Bahrain, with the federation citing violation of no-objection certificate protocols.

I am jealous: Travis Head taunts media scrutiny over Ben Duckett Noosa drinking row Travis Head came out strongly in defence of Ben Duckett amid the Noosa controversy. The Australian opener said he reached out personally, insisting players deserve understanding despite the constant scrutiny of elite cricket.

Babar, Rizwan, Afridi, Rauf to skip Sri Lanka T20Is for BBL commitments Pakistan tour of Sri Lanka: Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf will skip the Sri Lanka T20I series due to Big Bash League duties. The three-match series will begin on January 7 in Sri Lanka.

Pride, now paid: How BCCI turned Indian cricket into a high-paying profession From Rs 2,100 match fees to Rs 7-crore contracts, we examine how the BCCI's broadcast boom, central contracts and domestic pay hikes transformed Indian cricket from a passion sustained by jobs into a full-time profession.

Watch: Liverpool's touching tribute as Van Dijk leads Diogo Jota's kids out at Anfield Anfield stood united in remembrance as Liverpool paid a moving tribute to Diogo Jota. From chants to symbolic gestures, football paused briefly as players, fans and family honoured a cherished figure.

The heist in the humidity: How Jimmy Gressier stole the world Jimmy Gressier shocked the world by winning the 10,000m race at Tokyo 2025. His victory ended decades of African dominance and signalled a new era in long-distance running.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in 2025: A year India learnt to savour Ro-Ko 2025 did not close with grand farewells for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. Instead, it unfolded as a year of quiet endings, shifting roles and timely reminders of why Indian cricket still leans on them.

RCB tribute? Paarl Royals get all out for 49 in SA20, fans start memefest Paarl Royals were bowled out for just 49 runs, the lowest score in SA20 history against Sunrisers Eastern Cape. The collapse sparked social media comparisons with RCB's infamous 2017 batting failure against Kolkata Knight Riders.

Women's Hockey India League 2025-26: Squads, schedule and all you need to know The Women's Hockey India League is set for its second season with four teams battling it out for the title. Here's all that you need to know about the upcoming season of the tournament being played in Ranchi.

Watch: Rohit Sharma signs Dhawal Kulkarni's glove in heartfelt Mumbai reunion Rohit Sharma shared a touching moment with former teammate Dhawal Kulkarni in Jaipur. From signing gloves to scoring big runs, Rohit's Vijay Hazare return ended with eyes firmly on India duty.

From Belgium with love: Hendrickx brings a champion's edge to Kalinga LancersA legend of the game, Alexander Hendrickx brings a champion's edge to the Hockey India League as the Kalinga Lancers eye a revival during the 2025-26 season. Hendrickx talks about the team's goals, Belgiums transitions and his role as a mentor for the youngsters in the Lancers squad.

Series in the bag, India Women eye bench strength testing against lifeless Sri LankaIND vs SL, 4th WT20I: After winning the series 3-0, India will be looking to chop and change and test out their best strength. Sri Lanka, on the other hand, will look to salvage some pride and make sure they avoid a cleansweep.

Bring Virat Kohli out of Test retirement: Navjot Sidhu reveals his one wish to godNavjot Singh Sidhu has made an emotional appeal for Virat Kohli's Test return. Citing Kohli's elite fitness and form, Sidhu believes a comeback would unite and uplift Indian cricket fans nationwide.

Rishabh Pant to be dropped from New Zealand ODI series: SourcesRishabh Pant is set to be dropped from India's ODI squad for the New Zealand series. His absence could open the door for in-form Ishan Kishan to return to the ODI setup, or Jitesh Sharma receiving his maiden call-up.

Wirtz will score many more goals for Liverpool: Slot backs star after Wolves winnerFlorian Wirtz finally announced himself at Anfield with a decisive Wolves winner. Backed firmly by Arne Slot, the Liverpool midfielder now enters a crucial January stretch with confidence growing around his long-term impact.

World Rapid C'ships: Gukesh, Erigaisi remain in hunt, Carlsen suffers rare lossD Gukesh continued his strong performance to remain in the hunt at the FIDE World Rapid Championship after nine rounds, with Vladislav Artemiev and Hans Niemann leading the standings. In the women's section, defending champion Koneru Humpy stays at the top of the standings.

Ganguly starts coaching stint with loss as Jo'burg Super Kings down Pretoria CapitalsSourav Ganguly's coaching tenure with the Pretoria Capitals started with a loss as they were beaten by the Jo'burg Super Kings in the SA20 on Saturday, December 27.

Stokes comes down heavy on Melbourne pitch: Hell would be unleashed elsewhereEngland ended their 18-Test winless streak in Australia by chasing down 175 for a four-wicket victory at the MCG, but concerns were raised over the playing surface after the match concluded within two days.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi named India captain for South Africa ODIs ahead of U19 World CupVaibhav Suryavanshi has been appointed captain of the India U19 team for the South Africa ODI series, following his record-breaking century in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Ayush Mhatre will miss the series due to a wrist injury, but will play in the U19 World Cup next year.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi in line for U19 World Cup debut as BCCI names 15-man squadVaibhav Suryavanshi is all set to make his bow in the U19 World Cup for India as BCCI announced the squad for the upcoming tournament on Saturday, December 27. Ayush Mhatre will be captaining the side during the tournament.

CSK new recruit Matthew Short stuns with stellar all-round show in BBLMatthew Short, CSK's new all-round recruit, impressed with a blistering 63 and 2 wickets in the BBL, though his efforts couldn't prevent Adelaide Strikers from losing by 7 runs to Brisbane Heat.

Shaheen Shah Afridi in big trouble, Pakistan suffer injury scare before T20 World CupShaheen Shah Afridi's knee injury during the BBL 2025-26 clash against Adelaide Strikers on Saturday raises concerns for Pakistan ahead of the 2026 edition of the Men's World Cup.

Frustrated with arm injury, Jack Draper pulls out of Australian Open 2026British tennis player Jack Draper has withdrawn from the 2025 Australian Open due to a persistent left arm injury, disappointing fans and leaving a spot open in the men's singles draw.

Women's World Cup loss vs India still hurts, revenge is on our minds: Australia pacerKim Garth shared that Australia are still feeling the sting of their semi-final loss to India in the Women's World Cup, but is looking forward to the upcoming bilateral series with India in 2026.

Yashasvi Jaiswal or Tere Naam's Salman? How Kohli teased batter during his 1st ODI hundredYashasvi Jaiswal revealed the funny side of batting alongside Virat Kohli and how the Indian star teased him with Salman Khan's Tere Naam song during his knock against South Africa in the third ODI.

Cricket Australia flags concern over short Tests after MCG game: Bad for businessCricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg has voiced serious concerns amid the two-day finish of the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, warning that short Tests are not good for business.

A lot thrown at this team: Root praises England's response after difficult Ashes tourJoe Root praised England's character after a rare Test win in Australia, saying the team responded strongly under pressure despite losing the Ashes series earlier in the tour.

Tragedy in Bangladesh Premier League: Dhaka coach dies after heart attack on fieldBangladesh Premier League 2026: Dhaka Capitals' assistant coach Mahbub Ali Zaki tragically passed away from a heart attack on the field just before their BPL opening match against Rajshahi Warriors on December 27.

Melbourne Test hero Tongue reveals he almost retired: Glad I stuck with cricketJosh Tongue revealed that he considered retiring from cricket following a string of injuries that has disrupted his international career for England. Tongue was the hero for England in Melbourne as they beat Australia in the 4th Ashes 2025 Test.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
